versos: (melteth) Psalm 46:6 - "The heathen raged, the kingdoms were moved: he uttered his voice, the earth melted.";;;
(watched) Mark 13:37 - "And what I say to you I say to all: Watch";;;
(robbery) Ezekiel 22:29 - The people of the land practice extortion and commit robbery; they oppress the poor and needy and mistreat the foreigner, denying them justice.;;;
(sink) Luke 5:7 - "So they signalled their partners in the other boat to come and help them, and they came and filled both boats so full that they began to sink.";;;
(pitch) Genesis 6:14 - "Make yourself an ark of cypress wood; make rooms in the ark, and cover it inside and out with pitch.";;;
(flourish) Psalm 92:12 - "The righteous will flourish like a palm tree, they will grow like a cedar of Lebanon.";;;
(forgave) Ephesians 4:32 - "Be kind and compassionate to one another, forgiving each other, just as in Christ God forgave you.";;;
(rechab) Jeremiah 35:6 - "But they replied, 'We do not drink wine, because our forefather Jonadab son of rechab gave us this command: 'Neither you nor your descendants must ever drink wine.'";;;
(teachest) Psalm 119:99 - "I have more understanding than all my teachers: for thy testimonies are my meditation.";;;
(pitied) Psalm 103:13 - As a father pities his children
(calm) Proverbs 17:27 - "The one who has knowledge uses words with restraint, and whoever has understanding is even-tempered.";;;
(slumber) Proverbs 6:9 - How long will you lie there
(laughter) Psalm 126:2 - Our mouths were filled with laughter
(lofty) Isaiah 2:12 - For the LORD of hosts has a day against all that is proud and lofty, against all that is lifted upand it shall be brought low;;;;
(skirts) Jeremiah 13:22 - "And if thou say in thine heart, Wherefore come these things upon me For the greatness of thine iniquity are thy skirts discovered, and thy heels made bare.";;;
(lowly) Philippians 2:3 - "Do nothing out of selfish ambition or vain conceit. Rather, in humility value others above yourselves.";;;
